DataElement.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Other Therapeutic Procedure Fourth Course Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Codes for the type of other treatment given as part of the fourth course of treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Treatment Subsequent Other Therapeutic Procedure Fourth Course
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Other treatment given as part of the fourth course of treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Subsequent; immediately following in time or order.

Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.:A period of protocol-prescribed activity or intervention.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
Following the third position in an ordering or series; coming next after the third and just before the fifth in position.
Passage through time; duration; a systematic or/and orderly succession; a sequence, e.g. course of treatment; a mode of action or behavior; natural development, typical manner of proceeding.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._A system of numbered categories for representation of data. [Explanatory Comment: Use 1998 ROADS Manual for codes; see Other Treatment.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Division of Cancer Control and Population Sciences

ReferenceDocuments.name: Subsq RX 4th Course Other Description
ReferenceDocuments.description: Central registries currently collecting this data item should follow the 1998 ROADS Manual coding instructions. The codes are the same as those for Other Treatment, 1998 ROADS Manual, p. 246.
